Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the severity of the situation by stating that deaths from domestic violence are at the highest in 10 years without considering alternative explanations or factors.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support as it is based on a statement made by a politician and a report from an advocacy group, without providing additional data or evidence to back up the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that deaths from domestic violence are solely caused by domestic abusers, without considering other factors such as suicides committed by perpetrators or incidents of self-defense.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the increase in deaths from domestic violence, such as changes in reporting or data collection methods.
